'''Sir John Boorman''' [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] (b. [[18 January]] [[1933]]) is an English film director who had planned [[John Boorman's The Lord of the Rings|a film adaptation]] of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', however the plan fell through, although he used some elements from his proposed film on the film ''Excalibur'', which he directed.

==Quotes==

{{quote|I met [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] when I was preparing the film and he asked me if the film would be live-action or animated; he was relieved we weren't animating the film. Well, we all know what subsequently happened with [[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)|Ralph Bakshi's version]] of Lord of the Rings which was animated.|John Boorman<ref name="Wired">Winnipeg Free Press, [http://newspaperarchive.com/ca/manitoba/winnipeg/winnipeg-free-press/1981/04-04/page-35 Apr 4 1981 Issue], (accessed 8 September 2014)</ref>}}
